column4: Hi, I'm very new to Ubuntu and need help do I just ask my question?

Cool :) Right, I've installed Ubuntu within my Win XP installation as I'm very interested in changing to Linux, the install has gone fine, but I can't get my wireless adapter to work. I look into installinh Ndiswrapper, nut it says I should have a wired connection to do this. Unfortunately, I only have a wireless connection... Am I screwed?
what is the wireless card model and brand?
ouch... D-Link... i never got mine to work... but it was a diffrent model, and ill admit, i was lazy and just gave up...
can i get a link to where you downloaded it?
im trying to open it.. hold on...
where do you have it saved right now?
ok, basicly, that has to be compiled
do you know how to get to that dir in the console
ok, the command to unzip it is tar -xvf file.tar.gz
did you sudo apt-get install build-essential?
dont worry about it, i have heard worse questions.. and what you are doing is actually a little difficult...
